page.title: 18COMERTON RIDING STABLES
page.content: Part of the leisure scene in Leuchars is the riding stable. Roughly 12 people go a week, Saturday is the busiest day. We also found out that summer is the busiest season. Comerton have 14 horses and ponies consisting of riding horses, show jumpers and eventers. Their horses eat hay which is bought from a hay farm in Upper Largo (but sometimes they buy it from elsewhere). The lessons cost Â£4.50 per day and when they go out on treks, they go riding up to Tentsmuir Forest and beach or just up to the moors. They take their horses to quite a few shows such as one-day events and hunter trials and they have got a a lot of rosettes and cups for cross country events. They also have a few certificates.
